column4: any cairo-dock users that could help with an odd icon problem?
cairo-dock is awesome ;)
yes, but cairo-dock is tricky when it comes to icons, you have to specify them directly, path-wise
yes, this is a problem with the way cairo-dock tracks the applications running
for example, to get it to focus thunderbird, i have to put in the cairo-dock launcher 'thunderbird-bin' but i actually run it with
thunderbird %U
b/c a lot of times the name of the application running doesn't match this executable
simply, when you right click on a cairo-dock launcher, you get 'modify launcher' or something like that
this is where i put thunderbird-bin, under command to run, or something like that
then, when thunderbird is running, i don't have a separate icon
just the highlight under the launcher
the problem is, thunderbird won't launch from thunderbird-bin
just check using the ps command, like ps -AF, it will tell you the t
'true' name an application is running under
i'm not classing my applications
i just keep the ones i use all the time, i.e. firefox, thunderbird, etc..., i.e. the ones that i never shut off
in the main toolbar
i just right click on the cairo-dock bar and do "+add manual launcher"
it works well for me, the applications i use *all* the time are always there
yeah, it's buggy in that respect
i like it because it doesn't, ever, crash, and looks a lot nicer than a panel dedicated to running applications
that, and it works in metacity, looks like garbage, but it works, so that if compiz crashes, i still have a little access

but i don't get rid of my gnome panel, i keep that on top, i just use the cairo-dock to keep track of running applications, because trying to keep then in the taksbar using alltray crashes when switching window managers
good luck!
